intro: Adonis bobroviana, commonly known as the Bobrovian glory-of-the-snow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with compound leaves divided into narrow, lance-shaped lobes. Its flowers are arranged in a raceme and are often adorned with a subtle fragrance. Adonis bobroviana is adapted to cold climates and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
